title: Mental health service use among Filipino American and Korean American young adults during the COVID-19 pandemic.
abstract: Despite the heightened mental health challenges amid rising Anti-Asian sentiment, Asian Americans have significantly underutilized mental health services, a trend that persisted even before the COVID-19 pandemic. Although considerable efforts have been made to understand how various factors are related to mental health service use in this population, research integrating these multiple factors in a single study, with a specific focus on ethnic disaggregation, remains limited.
